This means that the person driving the train cannot be a fan of punk, and there must be someone to the right of them who is.


Clue 2: The person watching thriller movies is the person driving the taxi.

|               |      1      |    2     |
| Movie-Genre   | Thriller    |          |
| Music-Genre   |             |          |
| Transport     | Taxi        | Train    |

The person driving the train must be watching a different movie genre, which is time-travel. Since the punk fan is to the right of them and we have thriller in column 1, time-travel goes with the train.


|               |      1      |    2     |
| Movie-Genre   | Thriller    | Time-travel|
| Music-Genre   |             |          |
| Transport     | Taxi        | Train    |

Given that the person driving the train is not a punk fan (from Clue 1) and there are only two music genres, indie must be associated with the train.

| Movie-Genre   | Thriller    | Time-travel|
| Music-Genre   |             | Indie    |
| Transport     | Taxi        | Train    |

By elimination, since punk is left and it's not associated with column 1 (thriller), punk goes with the taxi.

| Music-Genre   | Punk        | Indie    |
| Transport     | Taxi        | Train    |
